content.description: Stimulus Check is a well-protected face-climb with a tricky, steep start.
content.location: Just uphill from the other routes, this climb follows a lichen-covered face on the upper part of Pandemic Rock. Scramble ~30 feet up easy terrain to clip the first bolt before the steeper climbing.

content.description: The Second Wave is a funky climb that requires technical edging and some trickery to navigate around two big roofs.
content.protection: 12 bolts (if I remember correctly) to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Just left of the tree at the base of the wall, follow bolts that trend rightward through two roofs.

content.description:
Steep, pinchy, and sustained, this climb is full-value from the moment you leave the belay atop "

Funemployment

" until you reach the chains.
content.location:
This climb is very obvious from the Crags approach trail. When you hit the Talus field below Woodstone, look up to find an obvious, steep, rounded arete. Climb "

Funemployment

" or scramble up to the big ledge below the arete.

content.description:
Funemployment is a fun climb that meanders along a bulging arete before continuing up a fun face. It finishes at a two bolt anchor on a massive ledge below the start of "

Positive Antibodies

".
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is just to the right of "

The Cure

" between two tall trees.

content.description: Cure For the COVID was the first route established at Pandemic Rock. This fun climb moves through several bulges, with one massive roof at around halfway.
content.location: Currently, this route is the lowest developed climb on Pandemic Rock. Look for the massive roof to find your way.
